      • getGsmSignalStrength

        public int getGsmSignalStrength()
        Get the GSM Signal Strength, valid values are (0-31, 99) as defined in TS 27.007 8.5 (http://www.xs4all.nl/~m10/mac/downloads/3GPP-27007-630.pdf) 0 -113 dBm or less 1 -111 dBm 2...30 -109... -53 dBm 31 -51 dBm or greater 99 not known or not detectable (Windows Mobile would have LINEDEVSTATUS.dwSignalLevel in the range 0x00000000 (weakest signal) to 0x0000FFFF (strongest signal).)
        Returns:
        the gsmSignalStrength

      • gsmSignalStrengthTodBm

        public static int gsmSignalStrengthTodBm(int signal)
        Parameters:
        signal -
        Returns:

        http://grepcode.com/file/repository.grepcode.com/java/ext/com.google.android/android/2.2_r1.1/com/android/server/status/StatusBarPolicy.java#StatusBarPolicy.updateSignalStrength%28%29, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7782028/display-androids-getgsmsignalstrength-value-in-percentage
